abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings covey a satisfactory project
            outcome, likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts, supported satisfactory
            performances by the Bank and Borrower. Lessons outline the
            partnership success due to the combination between the Bank
            financing, the Government of Finland grant. The focus on
            inspection and enforcement balanced the soft loan provided
            to the end-users, taking into account the prevailing
            conditions during project preparation. Lessons further
            reinforce the importance of design flexibility, for it
            allowed the project to survive external shocks through
            corrective measures. However, any future projects should
            probably be more results oriented in terms of environmental
            improvement objectives. It is important to highlight that
            involving training institutions and industrial organizations
            in the project has been essential in attracting high numbers
            of participants, and in ensuring sustainability, and wide
            dissemination of experience gained. Lessons on the project
            as a vehicle for dialogue with the Government, can be
            measured through the keenness of the Ministry of
            Environment, as well as the Apex bank in particular, to
            replicate and build on the project's experience.
